title: Patricia Hall (novelist)
text:
Patricia Hall is the pseudonym used by journalist Maureen O'Connor in writing crime novels featuring reporter Laura Ackroyd and DCI Michael Thackeray.
Biography.
Maureen O'Connor was born in <a href="Bradford%2C%20West%20Yorkshire">Bradford, West Yorkshire</a> in 1940. She graduated from <a href="Birmingham%20University">Birmingham University</a> and worked at the <a href="BBC">BBC</a>, and "<a href="Evening%20Standard">Evening Standard</a>". She then spent 16 years creating, editing and writing for the education section of "<a href="The%20Guardian">The Guardian</a>" before switching to freelance journalism and fiction writing. She has a husband and two sons and lives in <a href="Oxford">Oxford</a>.
Writing.
The major series produced by Hall features reporter Laura Ackroyd and police detective Michael Thackeray. The series is set in Bradford and 
confronts issues of 'environmentalism, class and race discrimination'.
She has now started writing a new series based around photographer Kate O'Donnell and set in 1960s London.
